column4: Hi, I need help with securing some accounts on my Ubuntu installation. I need to make it so that another account cannot view files in someone elses /home/ folder. Would chmod be what I need to use?
First off, are the other users in the admin group? if so they could just use sudo and access them anyway, so obviously have to take care of that first
Check what groups they're in, you can check via the GUI I'm sure, the non admins should not be in the admin group
they are under the group ircd, which is also the account name
